intro: Phyllodes rossii, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems and produces small, pea-like flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, and it is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Phyllodes rossii is well adapted to arid environments and is an important component of native vegetation in its habitat.
